1.caption_en:
Caption:
A one-page "Platform Architecture Assessment" worksheet (v1) for scoring five pillars of platform architecture—Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization—featuring checkbox-style scoring circles, guidance bullets, a Purpose panel, How To steps, and AWS/fastbreak.one branding.

JSON:
{
  "type": "worksheet",
  "title": "Platform Architecture Assessment",
  "version": "v1",
  "page_number": 49,
  "branding": [
    "AWS",
    "fastbreak.one",
    "PIK"
  ],
  "layout": "two-column; left column: assessment grid with criteria and scoring circles; right column: Purpose and How To instruction panels",
  "scoring": {
    "columns": 2,
    "scale": 5,
    "visual": "row of circular check/radio marks per criterion"
  },
  "criteria": [
    {
      "name": "Operational Excellence",
      "guiding_questions": [
        "How do you plan to manage operational changes to the Platform?",
        "How do you anticipate operational failures and plan accordingly?"
      ],
      "sub_criteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon": "gear/operations"
    },
    {
      "name": "Performance Efficiency",
      "guiding_questions": [
        "How do you plan to identify right size workloads?",
        "How do you design to scale for multi geo, global platform users?"
      ],
      "sub_criteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon": "performance/scale"
    },
    {
      "name": "Security",
      "guiding_questions": [
        "How do you design for security across all layers?",
        "How do you protect data in transit and at rest?"
      ],
      "sub_criteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon": "lock/security"
    },
    {
      "name": "Cost Optimization",
      "guiding_questions": [
        "How do you intend to choose cost effective technology solutions?",
        "How do you plan to measure the technology cost consumption?"
      ],
      "sub_criteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon": "currency/cost"
    },
    {
      "name": "Reliability",
      "guiding_questions": [
        "How do you scale horizontally to improve system availability?",
        "How do you size for right capacity needs?"
      ],
      "sub_criteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon": "reliability/availability"
    }
  ],
  "total_score_section": {
    "label": "TOTAL SCORE",
    "prompt": "Based on the individual scorings of the 5 pillars, what is the overall score of your platform? Looking at the individual scores, what are the top 1-2 areas for improvement?"
  },
  "purpose_panel": "The Platform Architecture Assessment helps you to assess how good you implemented the Well Architecture Principles. Based on your assessment you can identify areas for improvement and prioritize activities together with your leadership & tech team.",
  "how_to_steps": [
    "Score each individual criteria together with your team - consider the sub-criteria",
    "Discuss the results with your team",
    "Give your architecture an overall score with the status date of the assessment. This helps you to monitor progress and trends.",
    "Present the results to your leadership team with clear priorities and actions for further improvements - always linked to the overall platform strategy and business model"
  ],
  "visual_elements": {
    "left_vertical_label": "PLATFORM ARCHITECTURE ASSESSMENT",
    "icons_present": true,
    "color_scheme": "blue/teal/grey accents"
  },
  "footer_text": "PLATFORM ARCHITECTURE ASSESSMENT v1"
}

2.caption_en:
Caption:
A Platform Architecture Assessment scoring template listing five pillars (Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization) with bullet best-practices, circular scoring fields per pillar, and a Total Score panel; branded with fastbreak.one and AWS.

JSON:
{
  "title": "Platform Architecture Assessment",
  "document_type": "scoring_template/assessment_form",
  "version": "v1",
  "language": "English",
  "purpose": "Assess platform architecture across five pillars and record per-pillar scores and a total score",
  "brands": [
    "fastbreak.one",
    "AWS"
  ],
  "layout": {
    "columns": 3,
    "rows": 3,
    "scoring_columns": 2,
    "total_score_panel": true,
    "scoring_bubbles_per_pillar": 8,
    "visual_style": "two-tone gray/blue, iconography for each pillar, bullet lists"
  },
  "pillars": [
    {
      "name": "Operational Excellence",
      "prompt": "How do you plan to manage operational changes to the Platform? How do you anticipate operational failures and plan accordingly?",
      "bullets": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon_present": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Security",
      "prompt": "How do you design for security across all layers? How do you protect data in transit and at rest?",
      "bullets": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon_present": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Reliability",
      "prompt": "How do you scale horizontally to improve system availability? How do you size for right capacity needs?",
      "bullets": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon_present": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Performance Efficiency",
      "prompt": "How do you plan to identify right size workloads? How do you design to scale for multi-geo, global platform users?",
      "bullets": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon_present": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Cost Optimization",
      "prompt": "How do you intend to choose cost effective technology solutions? How do you plan to measure the technology cost consumption?",
      "bullets": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ],
      "icon_present": true
    }
  ],
  "detected_text_excerpt": "CRITERIA, Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, TOTAL SCORE, PLATFORM ARCHITECTURE ASSESSMENT v1",
  "visual_notes": "Template contains pillar icons (gear, lock, compass, performance icon, currency icon), circular score selectors aligned to each pillar, and a shaded area for total score and improvement notes.",
  "image_dimensions_px": {
    "width": 1383,
    "height": 768
  }
}

4.caption_en:
Caption:
A one-page "Platform Architecture Assessment" template for scoring and prioritizing improvements across five well-architected pillars, with guidance on purpose and steps to use the assessment. The sheet includes scoring circles, sections for Operational Excellence, Performance Efficiency, Security, Cost Optimization, Reliability, a total score area, and AWS/fastbreak.one branding.

{
  "artifact_type": "assessment_template",
  "title": "Platform Architecture Assessment",
  "version": "v1",
  "language": "ENG",
  "page_number": 49,
  "purpose": "Helps assess how well the Well Architecture Principles are implemented and identify/prioritize areas for improvement with leadership and tech teams.",
  "layout": {
    "format": "single_page_landscape",
    "main_columns": ["criteria", "scoring", "scoring", "criteria_explanations"],
    "scoring_visual": "rows_of_selectable_circles_per_criterion"
  },
  "criteria": [
    {
      "name": "Operational Excellence",
      "questions": [
        "How do you plan to manage operational changes to the Platform?",
        "How do you anticipate operational failures and plan accordingly?"
      ],
      "subcriteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "Performance Efficiency",
      "questions": [
        "How do you plan to identify right size workloads?",
        "How do you design to scale for multi geo, global platform users?"
      ],
      "subcriteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "Security",
      "questions": [
        "How do you design for security across all layers?",
        "How do you protect data in transit and at rest?"
      ],
      "subcriteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "Cost Optimization",
      "questions": [
        "How do you intend to choose cost effective technology solutions?",
        "How do you plan to measure the technology cost consumption?"
      ],
      "subcriteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "Reliability",
      "questions": [
        "How do you scale horizontally to improve system availability?",
        "How do you size for right capacity needs?"
      ],
      "subcriteria": [
        "Perform Operations as Code",
        "Make frequent, small, reversible changes",
        "Refine operations procedures frequently",
        "Anticipate failure",
        "Learn from all operational failures"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "total_score_section": {
    "title": "TOTAL SCORE",
    "description": "Based on the individual scorings of the 5 pillars, what is the overall score of your platform? Identify top 1-2 areas for improvement."
  },
  "how_to": [
    "Score each individual criteria together with your team - consider the sub-criteria",
    "Discuss the results with your team",
    "Give your architecture an overall score with the status date of the assessment to monitor progress and trends",
    "Present the results to your leadership team with clear priorities and actions for further improvements"
  ],
  "branding": [
    "AWS",
    "fastbreak.one",
    "PIK"
  ]
}
